name: jQuery fastClick
body:
### Introduction

jQuery fastClick works around the 300ms delay for the click event in some mobile browsers. It's based on the idea from [Google](http://code.google.com/mobile/articles/fast_buttons.html).

### Usage

```
$('button').fastClick(function() {
  alert('clicked!');
});
```

### Installation

Get the repo:

```
$ git clone https://github.com/dave1010/jquery-fast-click.git
```

Just the file:

```
$ wget https://raw.github.com/dave1010/jquery-fast-click/master/jQuery.fastClick.js
```

### License

Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License

### Authors and Contributors

Original idea from [Google](http://code.google.com/mobile/articles/fast_buttons.html). jQuery plugin by Dave Hulber (@dave1010). Contributions from @jbroadway, @KyleAMathews and @jnormore.

### Support

Please [submit a ticket](https://github.com/dave1010/jquery-fast-click/issues) if you have an issue. For technical support, [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/) is your best bet.
tagline: Work around some mobile browser's 300ms delay on the click event.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
